articles.title: FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. for Taking Issue with DPRK over Flesh Traffic
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. for Taking Issue with DPRK over Flesh Traffic 
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Wednesday gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA as regards the fact that the U.S. recently took issue with the DPRK over flesh traffic:
					 The U.S. Department of State in its 2015 report on flesh traffic on July 27 slandered the DPRK, referring to the flesh traffic in different countries. It termed the DPRK "a source of flesh traffic," asserting that many of trespassers are sold off to flesh traffickers of other countries and it has made no effort to prevent the practice. The report went the lengths of citing misinformation about forced labor and concentration camps in a sinister bid to malignantly slander the dignified DPRK as it did in the past. 
					
					 The U.S., the worst abuser of human rights and biggest flesh trafficker in the world, shamelessly talked rubbish over the "human rights issue" in the DPRK as if it were "a human rights judge". This is just like a guilty party filing the suit first and a vivid expression of its hostile policy towards the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. has got corpulent through hundreds of years-long slave trade as it was founded as a result of genocide.
					
					 The U.S. is vociferating about any "flesh traffic," telling sheer lies, but no one would pay heed to them.
					
					 The U.S. is cooking up a flurry of such false documents as it found it hard to bring down the DPRK by force. This is a revelation of its cynical ploy to internationally isolate the DPRK by such poor method of hurling mud at its social system and a carefully worked out scenario to realize the ambition for bringing down the system at any cost. 
					
					 It is an unbearable insult and mockery of the DPRK that the U.S. is trumpeting about any "flesh traffic" which can never exist under the former's socialist system whereby the people are fully exercising the independent right as masters of the country and realizing their beautiful dreams and ideals. 
					
					 The undisguised hostile intention of the U.S. to bring down the social system of the DPRK will only further harden the will of its service personnel and people to defend the socialist system, their cradle, firmly adhering to the Songun politics and the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts as treasured swords.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Mexico Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Mexico Appointed 
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Gil was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Mexico, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: GAC Group 2015 ITTF World Tour Pyongyang Open Starts
articles.content:
GAC Group 2015 ITTF World Tour Pyongyang Open Starts
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The GAC Group 2015 ITTF World Tour Pyongyang Open started at the Table-Tennis Gymnasium in Chongchun Street here on Wednesday.
					 It brought together players from the DPRK, Syria, Switzerland, Singapore, Vietnam, China and the U.S. They will compete in singles and doubles of men and women at adult category and in singles of under-21 men and women. 
					
					 The games will go on until August 2.

articles.title: Scientific and Technological Public Presentation in Field of Fiber Paper Held
articles.content:
Scientific and Technological Public Presentation in Field of Fiber Paper Held
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A national public presentation of science and technology in the field of fiber paper was held at the Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry Wednesday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were officials, scientists, technicians, teachers and post-graduate students in the field of fiber paper industry. 
					
					 Tens of valuable papers were presented by different units. They included the Ministry of Chemical Industry, Ministry of Food and Consumer Goods Industries, Publication Guidance Bureau, Chemical Fiber Institution of the State Academy of Sciences and Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry. 
					
					 Those who took the floor introduced successes and experience made in developing the fiber paper industry such as the local production of pulp and chemical stuff and improvement of their quality, development of a new chemical fiber and stepped-up modernization of production processes.
					
					 At the public presentation, there was a lecture on the trend of development in the field of paper industry and scientific and technical issues of developing and using more fiber resources of the country.

articles.title: President of World Chess Federation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
President of World Chess Federation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kirsan Ilyumzhinov, president of the World Chess Federation, and his party visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Wednesday.
					 Being briefed on the time-honored old home of the President, they looked round historical relics at his old home in Mangyongdae.
					
					 They also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea on the same day.

articles.title: Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed
articles.content:
Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and staff members of his embassy enjoyed a circus show given by the National Circus at the Pyongyang Circus Theater on Wednesday on the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 Working people in Pyongyang appreciated the show with them.
					
					 The acrobats showed their unique stunts and good artistic talents to feature of the army and people of the DPRK full of optimism.

articles.title: Korea International Sports Travel Company
articles.content:
Korea International Sports Travel Company
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Korea International Sports Travel Company, located in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang, renders various services to foreign tourists during their visit to the DPRK.
					 In this regard, Choe Tong Un, vice-director of the Korea International Sports Travel Company, told KCNA:
					
					 The company, founded in January Juche 86 (1997), is one of big travel companies of the country and has contacts with many travel agencies in Asia and Europe.
					
					 The company organizes colorful sports tours, including marathon, mountaineering, golf, bowling, shooting, swimming, skiing and cycling.
					
					 Foreigners would experience the customs of the Korean nation during their tour.
					
					 For the tourists willing to invest in development of tourist destinations and their infrastructure, they can visit the sites of projects and have talks with officials concerned.
					
					 The company is making efforts to diversify sports tourism and improve services, while paying deep attention to promoting tourism in close cooperation with foreign travel agencies.

articles.title: "Jogolryong"-trademarked Sports Drinks
articles.content:
"Jogolryong"-trademarked Sports Drinks
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- "Jogolryong"-trademarked drinks are getting popular among sportspersons.
					 The drinks are mainly made of shizandra, wild pear, fructus actinidiqe and other fruits, which grow in the area of Jogol Pass bounded by Usi County, Jagang Province and Pyokdong County, North Phyongan Province.
					
					 The drinks have good effects on increasing lung capacity and relieving fatigue.
					
					 An official concerned of the Ministry of Physical Culture and Sports told KCNA that their quality is as good as that of foreign-made sports drinks.

articles.title: "Katsura-Taft Treaty", Product of Conspiracy between U.S. and Japan
articles.content:
"Katsura-Taft Treaty", Product of Conspiracy between U.S. and Japan
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- 110 years has passed since the signing of the "Katsura-Taft Treaty" between the U.S. and Japan. 
					 The treaty was a criminal one, in which Japan admitted the U.S. occupation of the Philippines in return for getting a nod of the U.S. to its suzerainty on Korea.
					
					 After the adoption of the treaty, the Korean nation could not but suffer from Japan's military occupation of and colonial rule over Korea, national division, disaster of war, etc. as a sacrifice for the heinous U.S. and Japanese imperialists.
					
					 As soon as the World War II came to a close, the U.S. set up a secret organ with former staff officers of Japan's Kwantung Army and Imperial Headquarters involved to frame war scenarios to invade the DPRK and the rest of the Far East. Based on those war scenarios, the U.S. provoked the Korean war in June 1950.
					
					 During the Korean war, Japan turned itself into a military and logistic base for the U.S. and, not content with this, dispatched its troops to Korea and took active part in the U.S. germ warfare.
					
					 Later, the U.S. has patronized and rendered assistance to Japan's moves for a military power and reinvasion. And Japan, availing itself of the U.S. Asian strategy, has been keen on its moves to emerge as a military giant and thus realize its old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere".
					
					 The U.S. in its recent report on "defense review" called for reinforcing the U.S. navy forces in Japan as well as the armed forces of Japan in order to have a military superiority in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 The U.S. and Japan amended the "U.S.-Japan Defence Cooperation Guidelines", which was signed in 1997, under the pretext of increased role of each side for the strengthening of the U.S.-Japan "alliance". On the other hand, the U.S. agreed with Japan on fostering cooperation in the latter's rewriting of its Constitution for "the exercise of the right to collective self-defense" and arms buildup.
					
					 All those facts clearly show that the U.S. and Japan, seized with wild ambition for world supremacy, are making every desperate effort to dominate the whole of Korea.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Puppet Group
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Puppet Group
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Recently the south Korean puppet group made a litany of jargons about the "settlement of the north's  nuclear issue" in the wake of the nuclear deal of Iran only to invite criticism and derision of public at home and abroad. 
					 A spokesman for the puppet Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the minister of Unification of south Korea talked rubbish that "the north's nuclear  issue should be ultimately resolved through negotiations" and "pressure on it would prove effective." South Korean conservative media claimed that "choice of bread instead of nukes would be a good model of settling the north's nuclear issue."
					
					 South Korean puppet Foreign Minister Yun Pyong Se and the representative for the six-party talks were busy touring neighboring countries, asserting that "the Iranian nuclear deal should be taken as an occasion of settling the north's  nuclear issue" and soliciting positive "support and role" in this respect, 
					
					 South Korean media and experts went the lengths of crying out for "boosting international cooperation to lead the north to dismantling its nukes," saying that "it was only the north that remains subject to UN sanctions over its nuclear issue".
					
					 These are nothing but childish remarks.
					
					 Commenting on the Iranian nuclear deal, public at home and abroad is unanimous in holding that "north Korea is different from Iran and its experience is hardly applicable to the north."
					
					 Alexander Zhebin, director of the Center for the Research on Korea of the Institute of Far Eastern Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences, said, when interviewed by Sputnik broadcasting service, that "it was illogical to compare north Korea's situation with the Iranian nuclear program."
					
					 He explained reasons as follows:
					
					 "North Korea declared that it is a nuclear weapons state after conducting three nuclear tests.
					
					 It also clarified that it is ready to fulfill its commitments as a nuclear weapons state. Under the situation where the U.S. is staging joint military drills with south Korea under the pretext of the north's nukes, Pyongyang will never give up its nuclear program unilaterally without any reward.
					
					 On the contrary Pyongyang considers the promotion of its nuclear program as the best option for protecting its power."
					
					 As recognized by the world, the DPRK is a full-fledged nuclear weapons state and its nuclear deterrent is indispensable for it to defend the sovereignty and vital rights from the U.S. nuclear threats and hostile policy that have lasted for over half a century. 
					
					 It is preposterous to compare the Iranian situation with that in the DPRK as it is harassed by ceaseless large-scale joint military drills and other military provocations of the U.S. and exposed to its biggest nuclear threat.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the south Korean puppet group behaves like an ostrich with its head in the sand.
					
					 South Korea cannot behave otherwise as it is a colonial servant of the U.S.
					
					 It is the puppet group that echoes the voice of Washington like a parrot and it is the south Korean authorities who have to read the face of their American master without having their own views.
					
					 When one serves a big power, one is bound to follow outsiders' mentality and one's eyes and ears no longer belong to one.
					
					 How miserable the south Korean puppet group looks.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrent for self-defense serves as the most powerful weapon guaranteeing the dignity of Songun Korea and national security and its position of a nuclear weapons state will get stronger in any adversity.
					
					 The group would be well advised to bear this in mind, though belatedly,
					
					 The DPRK will consistently maintain the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts, no matter what other country does, and the mission of its nuclear force will remain unchanged as long as the U.S. pursues hostile policy towards it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Patriotism Serves as Engine for Building Thriving Nation: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Patriotism Serves as Engine for Building Thriving Nation: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday dedicates an article to the 3rd anniversary of the publication of Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism".
					 The work published on July 26, Juche 101(2012) says that Kim Jong Un formulated leader Kim Jong Il's noble patriotism as Kim Jong Il's patriotism and calls upon all service personnel and people across the country to bring earlier the final victory in the drive for building a thriving socialist nation by thoroughly applying Kim Jong Il's patriotism, the most vivid expression of socialist patriotism, to practice.
					
					 The article says:
					
					 The idea and the spirit reflected in the work call on all people to get united and emerge victorious, inspired by Kim Jong Il's patriotism. They serve as an engine instilling into the service personnel and people redoubled courage and fighting spirit.
					
					 The  firm will and tested leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea to usher in a new turning phase in building a thriving socialist nation by giving fullest play to patriotism with Kim Jong Il's patriotism as a torch have  brought about great victory and epoch-making changes in this land. 
					
					 No force on earth can arrest the heroic struggle of the army and people of the DPRK to achieve prosperity of the great Paektusan nation, setting their hearts ablaze with Kim Jong Il's patriotism. This is the precious truth taught by their struggle over the past three years.
					
					 For the Korean people, Kim Jong Il's patriotism serves as immensely dear, ideological and mental pabulum and nutrient of indomitable fighting will and enthusiasm as it shines as warm love for the socialist country and its people and the most positive and self-sacrificing devotion to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people, concludes the article.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Urged Not to Go against People's Will for Peace: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Urged Not to Go against People's Will for Peace: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Japanese scholars, intellectuals and other ordinary citizens are coming out in protest against the security bills proposed by the government. Protest actions were staged by nearly 100,000 people in the evening of July 15, the day before the railroading of the security bills through the session of the House of Representatives. It was reported that this was the largest-ever demonstration in the history of Japan.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Wednesday says the Japanese people are strongly protesting against the bills because the bills are very dangerous war bills which endanger the destiny of the country.
					
					 In the post-war period, Japan has made a peaceful development, not suffering such disaster as war entirely thanks to the "Pacifist Constitution", the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 But the situation is quite different from it.
					
					 Talking about "change of security environment", the present regime of Japan is claiming that it should take an active part in offensive military operations overseas so as to protect the security of the people.
					
					 The security bills which the  Japanese authorities are working hard to make a law will allow Japan to come out as a belligerent party  for the security of its allies such as the U.S. in case there is no threat of direct attack on the country. This means that Japan becomes a target of the other belligerent party by itself.
					
					 In this sense, the security bills are very dangerous bills for suicide as they lead the country not only to war but to disaster. This is precisely the reason why the Japanese people are so dead-set against the bills.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better stop their rash actions, mindful that those going against the people's mindset have no future.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Performed for Victory in War Serve as Eternal Treasure of Songun Korea: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Performed for Victory in War Serve as Eternal Treasure of Songun Korea: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) --The shining victory brought about by President Kim Il Sung in the Fatherland Liberation War in the 1950s serves as undying feats performed on  behalf of the country, the nation and humankind, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 July 27, the V-day, guarantees the dignity of Korea today and the bright future of the socialist cause, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists ignited the Korean war, buoyed by the ambition for world domination and being overconfident of its might. But it was a foolish challenge to the DPRK guided by the great leader and a prelude to their fate destined to sink like a setting sun.
					
					 The victory in the war was a victory of the President's outstanding military idea, stratagems and war methods. It was, at the same time, victory of his indomitable will and rare leadership art.
					
					 It is of great significance that the victory was won in the war for repelling the imperialists' aggression. Its genuine significance lie in that it is adding to the dignity and might of the country and powerfully propelling the struggle and advance of the popular masses as an unquenchable flame of revolution not only during the war but for the generations to come.
					
					 Therefore, the above-said exploits performed by the President can be called a lifeline of the great Paektusan nation and its eternal treasure.
					
					 Thanks to the President's feats, the DPRK could always hold initiative in the unprecedented confrontation with imperialism and the U.S. that has lasted for more than half a century and could have been on a winning streak and build a people's paradise from debris and turn it into an invincible political and military power.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Call for Actions against Illegal Introduction of Anthrax Germs
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Call for Actions against Illegal Introduction of Anthrax Germs
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in South Kyongsang Province, south Korea, including the South Kyongsang Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and the South Kyongsang Provincial Alliance for Progress, held a meeting outside the building of the U.S. military advisory group in Changwon City on July 25 denouncing the U.S. forces in south Korea for their illegal introduction of anthrax germs.
					 Speakers accused the regime of making desperate efforts to gag the people critical of the illegal introduction of anthrax germs and experiments of germ weapons, while keeping mum about the crimes committed by the U.S. forces.
					
					 The organizations decided to conduct various forms of activities denouncing the illegal introduction of anthrax germs in the future.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Security Authorities' Crackdown upon Reunification Movement Organization under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Security Authorities' Crackdown upon Reunification Movement Organization under Fire 
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet security authorities arrested the co-representative of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy and two other leading members on July 23, 25 and 26, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People.
					 The puppet authorities are now kicking up a whirlwind of wholesale crackdown upon the solidarity after labeling its actions opposing the "yusin" dictatorial rule and condemning the U.S. forces' introduction of anthrax germs "enemy-benefiting" ones.
					
					 The fascist police searched six places including the solidarity's offices, the venue of sit-in strikes staged by its leading members, printing house and website-management enterprise on July 15.
					
					 It also issued arrest warrants against ten leading members of the solidarity.

articles.title: 2015 Peace Action Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
2015 Peace Action Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- South Koreans from all walks of life launched the 2015 peace action near Rimjin Pavilion on July 25. 
					 Participants declared that their practical task for marking the 70th anniversary of August 15, the day of the liberation of the country, is to hold in check the deployment of THAAD in south Korea and Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defense". 
					
					 They staged a demonstration, shouting slogans "Let's put an end to war!" "Let's live in peace!" and "Let's go to achieve reunification!" and singing various songs, including the one calling for going to Mt. Paektu in the spirit of reunification.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Protest against U.S. Forces' Experiments of Anthrax Germs
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Protest against U.S. Forces' Experiments of Anthrax Germs
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. staged actions in the U.S. on July 25 in protest against the experiments of anthrax germs conducted by the U.S. forces present in south Korea, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 At the rally held in front of the White House, the participants denounced the U.S. forces in south Korea for introducing anthrax germs and conducting bio-chemical weapons experiments.
					
					 In a written protest addressed to Obama, they condemned the U.S. government and the south Korean "government" for violating various international laws and demanded the U.S. stop experiments of anthrax germs.
					
					 Meanwhile, there took place a similar protest action in Los Angeles.

articles.title: Foreign Media Observe V-Day of DPRK
articles.content:
Foreign Media Observe V-Day of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers and broadcasting services carried special write-ups to mark the 62nd anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Lao paper Congtap Pasason Lao on July 24 carried an article titled "Victorious tradition of DPRK" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung addressing the military parade for marking war victory.
					
					 The paper cited numerical data to detail how the U.S. ignited the Korean war by instigating the south Korean puppet army to realize its wild ambition for world domination only to be defeated for the first time in its history.
					
					 The U.S. was forced to sign the armistice agreement little short of a surrender document on July 27, 1953, the paper noted, adding that July 27 would be recorded forever as the day of victory for the Korean people.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on July 22 in its article titled "July 27 of Korea" said that the DPRK, a small country in the East, created a myth as it defeated multinational troops, which had come in attack under the helmet of the "UN Forces", for the first time in the world.
					
					 On the same day, Guinean domestic and international broadcasting services also introduced the Songun leadership exploits performed by the President.

articles.title: Month of Anti-U.S. Joint Struggle Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Month of Anti-U.S. Joint Struggle Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A solidarity meeting was held in Kyrgyzstan, a photo exhibition in Nigeria and a lecture and film show in Guinea on July 20 and 23 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Displayed at the venue of the photo exhibition were photos documenting the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also on display there were photos showing the achievements made by the service personnel and people of the DPRK in the struggle for building a thriving socialist nation and achieving national reunification.
					
					 Korean film "Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War" was shown at the film show.
					
					 The chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan who is chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists started the war against the young DPRK on June 25, 1950.
					
					 The U.S. suffered a disastrous defeat by the army and people of the DPRK led by Kim Il Sung although it mobilized armies of its 15 satellite countries, south Korean puppet army and even remnants of the former Japanese army.
					
					 A vice-director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria said in a speech that the DPRK, not a big country in the East, worked the miracle of defeating the imperialist allied forces, who had made an attack under the helmet of "UN forces", for the first time in the world thanks to the strategies, tactics and military war methods of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Forcibly Detaining DPRK Residents
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Forcibly Detaining DPRK Residents
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Nigerian and Beninese personages released statements on July 23 to denounce the south Korean puppet group of traitors for committing another heinous provocation act of unjustly detaining DPRK residents.
					 Ibrahim Mantu, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria who doubles as chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, said that the south Korean authorities have not sent back the residents while talking about "defection". He severely condemned it as an unpardonable unethical act in view of international law and morality.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not abuse the noble humanitarian issue for meeting their sinister political aim but unconditionally send the DPRK residents back to their families.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" who doubles as chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, demanded the south Korean authorities send back the DPRK residents without delay just as the DPRK displayed noble humanitarian spirit and compatriotism of sending all south Korean fishermen and boats drifted northward in the past and come out for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Return of Detained DPRK's Residents Demanded by Nigerian Body
articles.content:
Return of Detained DPRK's Residents Demanded by Nigerian Body
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities should stop at once the anti-DPRK racket precipitating its ruin and immediately and unconditionally send back DPRK residents detained unreasonably.
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said this in an article posted on its website on July 15.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The forced detention of DPRK's residents was not unexpectedly committed by a few individual military gangsters but under the patronage of the south Korean authorities.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have formed a "joint investigation team" with the Intelligence Service, the Ministry of Unification, the military and police involved and worked hard to threaten and coax DPRK residents drifted due to unexpected accidents into "defecting" in a bid to use them as hostages for anti-DPRK smear campaign.
					
					 Their premeditated provocation driving the inter-Korean relations into more catastrophic phase and deteriorating the situation arouses serious concern among progressive mankind.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano a acreditarse en Mexico
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano a acreditarse en Mexico
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- Segun un decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Hyong Gil fue nombrado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en los Estados Unidos Mexicanos.

articles.title: Agencia Internacional de Turismo Deportivo de Corea
articles.content:
Agencia Internacional de Turismo Deportivo de Corea
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- La Agencia Internacional de Turismo Deportivo de Corea ofrece los turismos de diversas formas, principalmente el de deportes y otros servicios amables, satisfaciendo asi la demanda de los turistas.
					Entrevistado con la ACNC, el vicepresidente de la Agencia, Choe Tong Un, dijo como sigue:
					
					Fundada en enero del 86 (1997) de la Era Juche, nuestra agencia es una de las grandes agencias de Corea.
					
					Tomando relaciones con las agencias de turismo de Asia y Europa, nuestra agencia cubre la demanda de muchos turistas del mundo que quieren ver con sus propios ojos los lugares famosos de nuestro pais. 
					
					Los funcionarios de gran experimentacion se encargan de la labor de invitacion a los turistas.
					
					Aseguran satisfactoriamente la comodidad de los turistas al realizar en alto nivel todos los servicios como medios de transporte, hoteles y guias.
					
					Organizamos los turismos deportivos inclusive maraton, alpinismo, golf, bolos, tiro, natacion, esqui y turismo en bicicleta y otras tales como la visita a los juegos deportivos nacionales e internacionales.
					
					Las experiencias practicas de las costumbres folkloricas de Corea como la elaboracion de tok, fideo y Kimchi, dan imborrable impresion a los turistas de varios paises.
					
					Se activan los trabajos para ofrecer la visita al destino a los turistas que tienen ganas de invertir en el desarrollo de los lugares turisticos y hotel del pais y en la construccion de infraestructura de turismo y las conversaciones con los organos y las empresas correspondientes.
					
					Estamos esforzandonos por desarrollar mas turismos deportivos por disciplinas y perfeccionar los servicios y activaremos el turismo al profundizar las relaciones con las agencias turisticas de varios paises.
					
					La agencia esta situada en el capitalino municipio de Mangyongdae.

articles.title: Iniciada competencia abierta de ping pong de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Iniciada competencia abierta de ping pong de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciada el dia 29 en el Centro de Ping Pong de la capitalina Avenida Chongchun la competencia abierta de ping pong de Pyongyang en el marco del Giro Mundial de la ITTF 2015.
					  En este certamen en que participan los jugadores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Siria, Suiza, Singapur, Vietnam, China y Estados Unidos, se realizaran los juegos simples y de parejas de ambos sexos a nivel de adultos y los simples de ambos sexos sub-21.
					
					  La competencia continuara hasta el 2 de agosto.

articles.title: Miembros de embajada cubana presencian funcion de Conjunto Circense Nacional
articles.content:
Miembros de embajada cubana presencian funcion de Conjunto Circense Nacional
Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del mes de solidaridad con el pueblo cubano, el embajador de la Republica de Cuba, German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana en Corea presenciaron el dia 29 en el Circo de Pyongyang una funcion del Conjunto Circense Nacional junto con trabajadores capitalinos.
					  A traves de la funcion, los ejecutantes demostraron bien aspectos romanticos del ejercito y pueblo de Corea.
